availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Orris Joslin Skinner (Whitley County, KY, attorney)

body.p: Whitley County, Kentucky, attorney. Vermont native. Son of Orson and Dorothea Skinner. Married to Sarah P. Clark on October 5, 1851 in Russell County. Father of Jennie M. Skinner, Julia M. Skinner, Elvira E. Skinner, and Mary E. Skinner. Appointed Postmaster in Russell County in 1848. Lawyer in Russell County, Kentucky in 1850. Lawyer in Whitley County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Vermont Vital Records through 1870, New England Historic Genealogical Society, Boston, Massachusetts, p. 2835.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Russell County, District 1, p. 224B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Whitley County, District 1, p. 733.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Russell County Marriages, Film #000594312, p. 109.
William G. Cutler, History of the State of Kansas (Chicago: A.T. Andreas, 1883), http://www.kancoll.org/books/cutler/woodson/woodson-co-p4.html#BIOGRAPHICALSKETCHESSKINNER-WILSON (accessed April 26, 2018).
Find A Grave, “Dr. J. O. W. ‘OJ’ Skinner (1817-1893),” Memorial #22570960, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/22570960 (accessed April 26, 2018).
